snippet: The democracy advocate Daw Aung San Suu Kyi assumed a new role in her country’s political transition.
abstract: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, silenced for two decades by Myanmar’s generals with house arrests and overturned elections, assumes a new role in her country’s political transition by apparently winning a seat in Parliament to make the remarkable shift from dissident to lawmaker; if the result is confirmed, the 1991 Nobel Peace laureate and the face of Myanmar’s democracy movement, will hold a public office for the first time.

byline.contributor: Steven Lee Myers contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The democracy advocate Daw Aung San Suu Kyi assumed a new role in her country’s political transition.

headline.seo: Party Claims Victory for Aung San Suu Kyi in Myanmar
headline.main: From Prisoner to Parliament in Myanmar
headline.print_headline: From Prisoner To Parliament In Myanmar
